msContents.summary: Lease of slaves, with rent to be paid in instead of money. A clause in the lease states that if the slaves die during the term of lease the loss is to be made good by the lessee. The offspring of the slaves are also to belong to the lessee. The lease is addressed to the Aurelii Petirius and Lycarion through their agent Apollinarios from Aurelius from the village of Ibion

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; back blank
19 lines; broken at right and bottom
The hand is a large, fluent cursive
Some damage at center and right

div.ab: To the Aurelii Petirios and Lykarion sons of Lykarion former beneficiarii through their agent Apollinarios from Aurelios Dioskouros residing in the village of Ibion. [l. 5] I wish to lease from you two cows belonging to you: one full-grown, tawny, named Isarion, the other . . . white named Teseuris [l. 10] for one year from the current month Hathyr in the 15th indiction at a yearly rental of six artabas of wheat and I shall pay the rental yearly. If death occurs, which I pray may not happen, the loss falls upon me, [l. 15] the lessee. The offspring of these also belongs to the lessee, and their care and entire maintenance falls upon him, and after the agreed period of time I shall return them in good condition . . .
